intro: Leontodon pycnocephalus, commonly known as the dense-headed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It is characterized by its compact, rounded inflorescence that resembles a small bell, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and woodland edges, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Leontodon pycnocephalus is a perennial herb that plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
